articles.title: Kids' physical activity dropped during pandemic, but researchers encouraged by more outdoor play | CBC News
articles.description: While COVID-19 health measures halted play dates and organized sports, many families seized the opportunity to go outdoors, a new report by ParticipAction says. But those opportunities weren't available to everyone, it says.
articles.content:
A new study attempts to quantify what many parents likely already know: dismal activity levels for kids and youth fell even further during the pandemic, while screen time soared.
